intro: Centaurea exaltata, commonly known as the tall helene, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring erect, branching stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. Its showy flowers consist of a central yellow disk surrounded by pink to red ray florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Centaurea exaltata is often found in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes.
